title: Punishment for murder
content: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Direction for grant of bail to person apprehending arrest
content: When any person has reason to believe that he may be arrested on accusation of having committed a non-bailable offence, he may apply to the High Court or the Court of Session for a direction under this section; and that Court may, if it thinks fit, direct that in the event of such arrest, he shall be released on bail.

case_name: Gurbaksh Singh Sibbia v. State of Punjab
summary: Landmark judgment on anticipatory bail. The Court held that the power to grant anticipatory bail is not unguided but must be exercised with care and caution.
key_findings: Anticipatory bail is a device to secure the individual's liberty.
No blanket order of bail can be passed.
The applicant must show reasonable apprehension of arrest.

title: Contradictory Provision
content: Notwithstanding anything contained in other sections, this provision contradicts the general rule and is overruled by special circumstances.
